description: From the participle stem of Latin ingurgitāre, from in- + gurges (“whirlpool”).

verbs.description: ingurgitate (third-person singular simple present ingurgitates, present participle ingurgitating, simple past and past participle ingurgitated)

entries.meaning: To swallow greedily or in large amounts.
(transitive) To swallow up, as in a gulf.
examples: If a man do but once set his appetite upon it [pleasure], let him ingurgitate himself never so deep into it, yet shall he never be able to fill his desire with it.
